titleTarget: 저 이번에 비행기 처음 타 보는 거예요.
titleNative: This is my first time on an  airplane.

dialog.speechTarget: 언니, 저 이번에 비행기 처음 타 보는 거예요.
dialog.speechNative: Eonni, this is my first time on an airplane.

dialog.speechTarget: 진짜? 고등학교 수학여행 갈 때 비행기 안 탔어?
dialog.speechNative: Really? You didn’t take an airplane when you went on your high school excursion?

dialog.speechTarget: 네. 저희 수학여행 배 타고 갔었어요.
dialog.speechNative: Yeah. We took a boat when we went on our trip.

dialog.speechTarget: 제주도를?
dialog.speechNative: To Jeju Island?

dialog.speechTarget: 네.
dialog.speechNative: Yes.

dialog.speechTarget: 그랬구나. 근데 나 같으면 비행기 타 보고 싶어서라도 제주도나 해외 여행 가려고 했을 것 같은데, 대학 다닐 동안 한 번도 안 갔던 거야?
dialog.speechNative: I see. If I were you, since you wanted to take an airplane, I would have gone to Jeju Island or on an overseas trip at least. You never went anywhere during your college years?

dialog.speechTarget: 네. 저는 여행을 막 그렇게 좋아하진 않아서, 여행 가려고 돈 모았다 가도 사고 싶은 게 생기면 그 돈으로 물건을 사 버렸어요. 노트북이나 그런 거요.
dialog.speechNative: Yup. I don’t really like traveling that much, so even after saving up money, if there was something I wanted to buy, I just bought it with that money. A laptop or things like that.

dialog.speechTarget: 아, 정말? 여행을 안 좋아하다니! 근데 사실 비행기 막상 타 보면 별 거 없어. 좁고.
dialog.speechNative: Oh, really? You don’t like traveling? Actually, when you are in the airplane, there’s nothing special. It’s really cramped.

dialog.speechTarget: 그래도 너무 아쉬워요. 탔다가 금방 내릴 테니까. 좀 더 길게 타고 싶은데.
dialog.speechNative: But still, it’s too bad, because we’ll be getting off the airplane soon after we get on it. I want to ride for a little longer.

dialog.speechTarget: 다음에 돈 모아서 해외여행 가. 멀리 여행 가는 것도 조금이라도 어릴 때 가야 된대. 나이 먹을수록 장시간 비행기 타면 힘드니까.
dialog.speechNative: Next time, save your money and go on an overseas trip. They say you should go on long-distance trips while you are still young. The older you get, the harder it becomes to fly for an extended period of time.

dialog.speechTarget: 그래요? 저는 좋기만 할 것 같은데.
dialog.speechNative: Really? I think I’ll just be happy without it.

dialog.speechTarget: 너도 몇 번만 타 보면 비행기 오래 타는 게 얼마나 곤욕인지 알 수 있을 거야.
dialog.speechNative: Once you take an airplane a few times, you will know how much of a pain it is to fly for a long time.

dialog.speechTarget: 비행기에 액체류 반입 제한 있다던데, 그건 뭐예요?
dialog.speechNative: I heard that there is a limit to carrying liquid onto the airplane. What is that about?

dialog.speechTarget: 아! 국제선 탈 때 액체류는 100ml 이하 용기에 담긴 것만 가지고 탈 수 있거든. 근데 우리는 국내선이라 상관없어.
dialog.speechNative: Oh, when you take an international flight, you can only board the plane with liquid that’s in a container that is less than 100ml. But we are on a domestic flight, so it doesn’t affect us.

dialog.speechTarget: 아... 그렇게 많은 액체를 사람들은 왜 가지고 타죠?
dialog.speechNative: Oh... Why do people carry so much liquid onboard?

dialog.speechTarget: 대부분 화장품이나 치약, 아니면 마실 물, 이런 거지, 뭐. 나도 지난번에 아무 생각 없이 물병 들고 타려다가 버리라고 해서 한 모금밖에 안 마신 거였는데, 버렸잖아.
dialog.speechNative: It’s mostly cosmetics, toothpaste, or drinking water, stuff like that, you know. I was about to get on a plane with a water bottle without thinking once, and they told me to throw it away, so I did, even though I had only taken a sip out of it.

dialog.speechTarget: 아, 치약 이런 것도 액체류에 속하는구나. 몰랐어요.
dialog.speechNative: Oh, things like toothpaste are also considered a liquid. I didn’t know that.

dialog.speechTarget: 응. 액체류랑 젤류 둘 다 제한한대. 자, 그럼 비행기 타러 들어가 볼까?
dialog.speechNative: Yeah, they restrict both liquid and gel. Now, shall we go get on our airplane?

dialog.speechTarget: 꺅! 신나요. 면세점에서 쇼핑해야지!
dialog.speechNative: Yes! I’m excited. I’m going to shop at the duty-free store.

dialog.speechTarget: 소연아, 미안하지만 김포공항 국내선에는 면세점이 없단다. 너무 실망하지 마. 제주공항에는 면세점 있으니까 올 때 쇼핑 마음껏 하렴.
dialog.speechNative: So-yeon, I’m sorry but Gimpo Airport’s domestic terminal doesn’t have a duty-free shop. Don’t be so disappointed. There is a duty-free shop at Jeju Airport, so do all the shopping you want on our way back.

vocabulary.nativeLanguageText: mostly, majority, for the most part
in the event, when S + is actually about to + V
to be narrow, to be cramped
to be difficult, to be tough, to be hard

patterns.patternNative: This is my first time VERB-ing.
patterns.exampleSentenceTarget: 저 이번에 비행기 처음 타 보는 거예요.
patterns.exampleSentenceNative: This is my first time on an airplane.

sampleSentences.nativeText: This is my first time eating this.
This is my first time buying a car.

exercises.exercise: This is my first time listening to this song.
exercises.answerKey: 이 노래 처음 들어 보는 거예요.

exercises.exercise: This is my first time doing this exercise.
exercises.answerKey: 이 운동 처음 해 보는 거예요.

appliedPatterns.patternTargetText: This is my first time on an airplane.
appliedPatterns.patternNativeText: 저 이번에 비행기 처음 타 봐요.
appliedPatterns.patternNote: 처음 -아/어/여 봐요 is more of a plain statement than the -는 거예요 ending, which is used to “explain” the background.

appliedPatterns.patternTargetText: This is my first time on an airplane.
appliedPatterns.patternNote: Even without the verb -보다, since the phrase has 처음, which means “the first time”, the meaning mostly stays the same.

patterns.patternNative: I just ended up VERB-ing. / I just happened to VERB. / (SUBJECT) just PAST TENSE VERB.
patterns.exampleSentenceNative: I just ended up buying something with that money.

sampleSentences.nativeText: I ended up coming all the way here.

sampleSentences.targetText: 치킨을 제 동생이 다 먹어 버렸어요.
sampleSentences.nativeText: My brother just ate all of the chicken.

exercises.exercise: The guy just left last month.
exercises.answerKey: 그 남자 지난 달에 떠나 버렸어요.

appliedPatterns.patternTargetText: I ended up buying something with that money.
appliedPatterns.patternNativeText: 결국 그 돈으로 물건을 사 버렸어요.

patterns.patternTarget: 막상 VERB + -아/어/여 보면 별 거 없어
patterns.patternNative: Actually, when you VERB, there’s nothing special.
patterns.exampleSentenceTarget: 비행기 막상 타 보면 별 거 없어.
patterns.exampleSentenceNative: Actually, when you are in the airplane, there’s nothing special.

sampleSentences.targetText: 막상 올라가 보면 별 거 없어.
sampleSentences.nativeText: Actually, if you go up there, there’s nothing special.

sampleSentences.targetText: 막상 먹어 보면 별 거 없어.
sampleSentences.nativeText: Actually, when you eat it, it’s nothing special.

exercises.exercise: Actually, when you meet them, they're nothing special.
exercises.answerKey: 막상 그 사람들 만나 보면 별 거 없어.

exercises.exercise: Actually, if you go there, there’s nothing special.
exercises.answerKey: 막상 가 보면 별 거 없어.

appliedPatterns.pattern: 막상 VERB + -아/어/여 보면 별 거 아니야
appliedPatterns.patternTargetText: Actually, when you are in the airplane, it’s nothing special.
appliedPatterns.patternNativeText: 막상 타 보면 별 거 아니야.

appliedPatterns.patternTargetText: Actually, when you are in the airplane, it’s just nothing.
